Amid the ruins of Gaza, Hamas celebrates the release of 2,000 Palestinian prisoners
subhead: 250 long-term detainees, most of them serving life sentences, were released from Israeli prisons after the Islamist movement freed the 20 remaining Israeli hostages who were still alive. More than 1,700 other Palestinians were also released.

title: France held by Iceland, loses perfect record in qualifying for World Cup
subhead: France were held to a 2-2 draw by Iceland in a 2026 World Cup qualifier on Monday.

title: In Switzerland, US tariffs are leaving industries at a loss
subhead: Two months after the implementation of a massive 39% customs tariff on many Swiss export products, affected Swiss companies have responded in scattered order.

title: Philippe Aghion, 2025 Nobel in economics laureate: 'The key factor of economic power is technological leadership'
subhead: The French economist was part of a trio that won the 2025 Economics Nobel Prize. In an interview, he argued that France and Europe must invest in innovation to maintain their status as economic powers.

title: Matthieu Blazy: 'Just because Karl was a legend does not mean that everyone who designs for Chanel has to be one too'
subhead: The anticipation was overwhelming. But on Monday, the first show by Chanel's new artistic director under the glass roof of the Grand Palais lived up to all expectations. With his impeccable CV and strong personality, the 41-year-old designer has written the first page of a new chapter for the fashion house. His mission? To usher it into a new era without losing its soul.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.
